decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill the board with creatures such as Narcomoeba, Ichorid, and Golgari Thug. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to manipulate the graveyard, the deck aims to bring back Prized Amalgam and other creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Creeping Chill provides additional reach and damage, while Force of Will and Force of Negation offer protection against opposing spells. The deck aims to win through a powerful combo of dredge creatures and graveyard recursion.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and powerful spells to establish a board advantage and control the game. It aims to generate a high amount of mana quickly through cards like Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop, while also using cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw additional cards and gain more resources. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere allows the deck to protect its key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With cards like Time Vault and The One Ring, the deck can easily win the game once it has established control.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of white and blue cards, utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares for control. It also includes efficient creatures like Mockingbird and Guide of Souls to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of versatility and card advantage. The deck also features disruptive spells like Flusterstorm and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and disruption, while utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. The deck also includes Show and Tell as an alternate way to put big threats into play. The deck aims to protect its strategy with cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, while also using planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to gain advantage over the opponent. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan and overwhelm them with powerful creatures.

The deck's focus is on controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It utilizes powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to keep the opponent in check. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog adds to the control aspect of the deck. By efficiently managing resources like the Moxen and efficient card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Gush, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck focuses on utilizing Mishra's Workshop to quickly ramp out powerful artifacts and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It includes key cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, Karn, the Great Creator, and Sphere of Resistance to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the board. With a mix of mana acceleration, efficient creatures, and disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategy with hatebear creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. It also includes disruptive cards like Wasteland and Void Mirror to slow down opponents, along with mana acceleration from mana rocks like Black Lotus and Moxen. The deck aims to control the board and limit opponent's options while quickly closing out the game with a mix of disruptive creatures and aggressive threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebear creatures to disrupt opponents while applying aggressive pressure. By using powerful cards like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper, the deck aims to slow down opponents' strategies while quickly overwhelming them with creatures. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Balance and Chancellor of the Annex further adds to the disruption. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration through artifacts like Chrome Mox and the Mox cycle to quickly deploy threats. The deck also features card advantage engines like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Witch Enchanter to maintain a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Underworld Breach to continuously cycle through spells from the graveyard, generating value and eventually setting up a win condition. It includes powerful cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall to quickly build up resources, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will to protect the combo. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value and recursion options. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently and consistently execute its combo strategy while maintaining control over the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard and bring back creatures like Hollow One, Prized Amalgam, and Ichorid. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Shambling Shell, the deck can consistently cycle through the graveyard and bring back threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Grief to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient board presence while disrupting their strategy.

The primary focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Dig Through Time to generate card advantage and gain tempo. With a solid mix of disruption, card draw, and threats, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent until it can secure a win condition.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and various lock pieces. It aims to maintain a strong board presence while controlling the tempo of the game, using powerful cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats efficiently. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion options. By leveraging card advantage and resource management, this deck can outlast opponents and secure victory through attrition and careful decision-making.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Fatal Push to disrupt opponents while also using card advantage tools like Dig Through Time and Ancestral Recall. The deck also includes key threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog to lock down the board and control the game to victory. Additionally, the deck runs disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt opponents' mana bases and maintain control.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive cards to control the game. By using efficient removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The inclusion of various tutors and card advantage spells like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor help to find key cards and maintain a consistent game plan. The deck ultimately aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggro and midrange elements, creating a versatile and powerful strategy.

The deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly by setting up a specific order of cards in the library to win the game. It includes powerful card draw and manipulation cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm to set up the combo efficiently. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and other counterspells to protect the combo. By efficiently searching for and assembling the necessary pieces, the deck aims to win the game in a single turn.

The deck aims to generate immense card advantage and mana through the use of Paradoxical Outcome and artifacts like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Black Lotus. The goal is to quickly assemble a combination of artifacts to generate a significant advantage in resources and card advantage, allowing the player to overwhelm their opponent with powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds resilience and recursion, making the deck difficult to disrupt and allowing for explosive turns of gameplay.
